page.title: 04DEVELOPMENT IN UPPER BEXHILL
page.content: The oldest houses are to be found in the Old Town area, but with the advent of the{railway in 1845}a complete new Victorian town grew up to the south. In the basically untouched countryside of our block only scattered dwellings were built then, within reach of the only road to Eastbourne or around Station Road, now London Road. Then a development was begun centred around Victoria and Albert Roads, now called Cambridge and Havelock. The{first major development in the{1930's}followed the railway line to link{Old Town with Sidley}to the north. Few houses were built during the 2nd World War but rapid {expansion}took place westwards from the{late 50's,}dominated by{Larkin,}a a well-known{local builder,}of mainly distinctive self-designed{bungalows.
